title: Help with this italic font?
content:
I am having trouble identifying this italic. Does anyone recognize it?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081016094844im_/http:/typophile.com/files/chron_6113.gif)

 [‹ London 2012 & SCD](http://web.archive.org/web/20081016094844/http:/typophile.com/node/50427 "Go to previous forum topic") [help identifying! ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081016094844/http:/typophile.com/node/50414 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Tonie Blaze

comments.content:
Hmmh, where is that from? How old is it?

It looks like mix between Zapf’s Michaelangelo and Palatino Italic.
It’s from a book by Tom Eagleton named War and Presidential Power. The first pages are missing so I don’t have a print date. It shows some wear, so it could be over 20 years old, I don’t know.
Also looks a bit like Aldus Italic by Zapf.
In case that helps, the book was published in 1974 from what I could gather.

There have been countless rips of Hermann’s work over the last 5 decades. Although it is strikingly similar to Michaelangelo let me make a few observations. There was never an italic, it is too bold and the R is not right as well as many of the serifs. Possibly phototypositor magic and a bit of noodling.

Michael

Definitely 1974:  
War and Presidential power: a chronicle of congressional surrender, Thomas F. Eagleton. New York, Liveright, [1974].

Cheer, Colin  
—  
No furniture so charming as books. Rev Sydney Smith, 1771 -1845
